Graduate Program

Company Name BASF Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 104 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Join a growing business focused on creating sustainable future
  • 18-month program with 3 rotations
  • Work on meaningful business projects
  • Up to 3 positions available\xa0
  • Diverse role supporting a wide range of industries


If you’re passionate about science and innovation, the BASF Grow Graduate Program is for you. The program provides training, development and opportunities across a diverse range of fields and roles in the world’s most innovative chemical company.
We offer our employees a commitment to diversity and inclusion, corporate volunteering programs including volunteering leave and a dedication to safety, health, environment and sustainability.
You will be encouraged to foster positive change, drive innovation and become a leader of tomorrow.

Our 2019 Grow Graduate Program

The BASF Grow Graduate Program will provide up to three graduates with the opportunity to join our team on an 18-month rotational program. You will complete three rotations in the 18 months across a range of business operations and functions to gain a broad understanding of our business in Australia and New Zealand.\xa0


Our Graduate program will offer you the opportunity to develop leadership and interpersonal skills, gain exposure to senior leaders, and apply your skills in meaningful projects that will enhance our business. As our business looks for innovative ways to tackle future problems, our Graduate program is designed to give you exposure to areas including manufacturing, supply chain, customer service, sales, marketing and technical support. Your role will be initially based at our Head Office in Melbourne, with potential to visit or work from our various satellite offices and production sites as necessary.

Applicant Criteria

Recently completed or expecting to finish tertiary qualification by January 2019
Able to start in February 2019
Innovative thinking and willingness to challenge the status-quo
Available for assessment activities in late September/early October 2018 in Melbourne
Unrestricted Australian work rights
Science degree or commerce/business degree
Driver’s license

Application Process

The application process will comprise an online application form and CV submission. Selected candidates will be also asked to submit a video application, interview and assessment.
Applications open 23rd August 2018 and close 7th September 2018. Further information about our Grad program is available here: https://on.basf.com/Grow_Graduate_Program

For BASF, diversity is one of the essential keys to business success and the well-being of our employees. We promote an inclusive culture that accepts the diversity of people, experiences and capabilities. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost creativity and motivation and enhance our teams' performance.
Join the team and connect with more than 110,000 other minds. Further information about BASF can be found at www.basf.com/au.

Please note that all applicants require the legal right to work permanently (citizenship or permanent residency) in Australia at the time of applying.

Business Analyst

Company Name Melton City Council Company Location Melton, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 372 views

Job description



Full Time Fixed Term until 30 June 2021

A dynamic, high-performing, customer-focused Information Technology (IT) team at Melton City Council are now looking for a Business Analyst to join their growing team.

This exciting opportunity will suit a motivated, highly skilled and experienced Business Analyst to perform current and future state analysis, gather requirements for solution designs and facilitate user acceptance testing across various projects within Melton City Council.

The City of Melton is one of the fastest growing urban hotspots in Australia with its population expected to more than double from 150,000 to 380,000 over the next 20 years.

The role will be responsible for working in partnership with stakeholders and IT technical staff to gather and validate business requirements, functional requirements and solution feasibility studies.

As a Business Analyst, another primary responsibility will be to facilitate the user acceptance testing conducted by the business representatives or ‘power users'. This role will assist power users with the development of test scenarios, support the testing execution and assist with the management of defects.

Strong knowledge of current and future process analysis, requirements management, user acceptance testing and IT feasibility analysis will be critical to your ability to be successful in the role.

Contact Novia Pradana, Business Engagement Co-ordinator on 9747-7190 for further details.

  • Government Administration
  • Financial Services

Media Activation Manager

Company Name Essence Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 121 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the role


The Media Activation team is responsible for providing thoughtful and exciting recommendations for Search, Social, Display, and Video, owning supplier relationships, and then executing those recommendations expertly. The Media Activation team leverages their mastery of each channel to make sure its recommendations are consistently excellent and innovative, and that in-channel performance and data integrity is maximized.



Some of the things we’d like you to do:


  • Translating client requirements into Biddable/Performance campaign delivery briefs

  • Effectively manage client deliverables to deliver on time and on target

  • Develop strong relationships with your client, acting as key channel expert

  • Be able to communicate with clients on subjects outside your remit, and provide them with useful insight

  • Ownership and monitoring of campaign to ensure that biddable/performance team provides proactive, strategic and tactical optimization recommendations

  • Lead end of month/quarter campaign wrap ups for biddable/performance channels

  • Regularly contribute to media best practices and campaign processes

  • Develop and execute rigorous testing plans

  • Craft actionable insights for weekly and quarterly reports

  • Manage the successful task delegation of work for 1-2 junior team members



A bit about yourself:


  • Approximately 3-5 years experience in a digital media agency

  • Expert knowledge of at least one biddable platform on SEM/Social/Display/etc.

  • Doubleclick or Adwords certification desirable

  • Knowledge of challenges for mobile & video in programmatic - e.g. SDK, VPAID/VAST

  • Experience with data integration projects - e.g. API, DMP, Analytics, etc

  • Proficiency in Excel (Pivot Tables, VLookups, etc)

  • A passion for everything digital, with an active interest and understanding of online advertising industry trends

  • Strong understanding of optimization levers & testing approaches

  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written

  • Great analysis skills (including quantitative analysis) and proven critical thinking capability

  • Proven experience managing people/teams



What you can expect from Essence


Essence’s mission is to make advertising more valuable to the world. \xa0We do this by employing the world’s very best talent to solve some of the toughest challenges of today’s digital marketing landscape. \xa0It’s important that we hire people whose values reflect those of our own: genuine, results-focused, daring and insightful. As an Essence employee, we promise you a workplace that invests in your career, cares for you and is fun and engaging. \xa0We believe these factors create a workplace where you can be yourself and do amazing work.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status.

Territory Sales Manager

Company Name Talend Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 118 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

Territory Sales Manager - Job description

Talend is a 1000+ employee data integration software company with deep open source roots. Well-funded, with over $185+ million raised to date and continued rapid growth, Talend is the second largest independent open source company in the world.

People join our teams globally to influence the way data is used in driving intelligent business decisions. They join to be part of a passionate group of highly talented people all sharing a vision of a data-connected world. Finally, they join because we know how to have fun!

We are seeking a Territory Sales Manager to join our fast growing APJ Sales team. The role will be located in Melbourne, Australia and handle new business for ANZ focusing on Victoria, Tasmania, South and West Australia.

The TSM will be responsible for driving net new business within their territory by effectively communicating and demonstrating the value of Talend solutions. You will be expected to drive pipeline and revenue through prospecting efforts, developing relationships with prospects, support of the Sales Development Rep (SDR), as well as building relationships and developing opportunities with partners. All of this should lead to a laser focus on closing direct business with clients in the ANZ region.

What You Will Be Doing
  • Working in a great team environment to help drive the presence of Talend in Australia and New Zealand
  • Drive targeted lead generation activities
  • Work with assigned SDR to set strategy and execute on that strategy for creating leads.
  • Work with partners for Lead Generation, Selling and Implementation
  • Manage and close sales cycle from start to finish
  • Manage pipeline and forecasts in salesforce.com and submit forecast weekly to management, ensuring to maintain forecast accuracy monthly
  • Present and assist at external marketing events
  • Achieve or exceed quota and accurately forecast quarterly

What You Bring To The Role
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Strong knowledge about BIG “DATA” technology
  • Strong understanding of cloud technology
  • Understanding customers’ business problems
  • Presentation skills
  • Understanding of data integration value propositions and how to position them
  • Experience in direct sales
  • Experience in indirect selling through partners
  • Experience in generation of structured proposals

What You’ve Done In Your Past
  • Significant experience in selling licensed software products to enterprise.
  • Familiarity of Software as a Service model.
  • Strong record of achieving revenue quota of at least $500K - $1 Million
  • Experience managing complex sales, with CCS (Customer Concentric Selling), in matrix organisation
  • Knowledge in creating proposals with an understanding of revenue recognition and royalty structures
  • Experience in working with partners for lead generation to closure of deals
  • Understanding of value of information to businesses and ability to elaborate
  • Must have excellent communication, PowerPoint and presentation skills
  • Must be self-starter and able to work independently within a matrix organisation
  • 5-8 years of experience in Software Sales.

Training Program Mgr, APJC

Company Name Amazon Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world.

To meet the growing demand for AWS Services across the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you have a passion for working in a dynamic environment and always put your customers at the forefront of everything you do, we’d like to speak with you!

As a Training Program Specialist, you’ll be responsible to drive operational efficiencies within AWS Training and Certification and drive requirements for new programs/initiatives across Asia-Pacific, Japan and China (APJC). Additionally, in the first six months you’ll also provide Training Coordination support (in rotation with other team members), interfacing with our customers, preparing reports and managing engagements end to end. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn the AWS business and develop an understanding of the area. Beyond this mark, the role will involve undertaking mentoring and coaching responsibilities of a small vibrant team. The ideal candidate will demonstrate hands-on experience in a training operations role encompassing multiple regions, implementing new products/services, with a customer-focused and analytical approach. You’ll also have a demonstration of having mentored or coached a small team.

Responsibilities
  • Perform business analysis on training initiatives (products/services, processes, systems and new regions) and manage roll outs of the initiatives in region to increase our capabilities of better serving customers (e.g. B2B invoicing automation, B2I Capabilities
  • Work closely with Accounting, Finance, Infrastructure, Tax, Legal, Operations, Vendors and Management teams to deliver initiatives/projects
  • Collaborate with regional training coordinators and operations teams to understand where operational efficiencies can be achieved
  • Provide training coordination support
  • Manage Customer Satisfaction related data and analytics
  • Coach and mentor team members
Basic Qualifications
  • Hands on experience rolling out strategic initiatives, process improvement and/or new products
  • Ability to perform business analysis and a passion for improving business processes.
  • International experience and/or experience working on cross-functional teams.
  • Proven track record of managing multi-faceted projects with the ability to deliver successfully to completion.
  • Previous experience coaching or mentoring a small team

Business Development Manager

Company Name Systemize Consulting Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 95 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

First of its kind role in Australia
Pick your own team, build your own capability
Establish your career in the AI industry, learn all about AI and how to sell it
Genuine monthly sales commissions



Systemize Consulting provide software development and data science services to medium and large organisation. With over 10 consultants nationally, our recent major successes include providing software and systems to Telstra to automate the delivery of the NBN Network worth over $2BN.


Recently we have developed a number of cutting-edge AI/machine learning systems and capability and now seeking to expand our strong consulting capability to solve prediction and automation problems in a wide variety of industry sectors.


As such, we wish to speak to very talented sales managers who are not afraid to take on and learn new ideas and concepts.\xa0 \xa0As this is a brand new industry, we are happy to hear from sales people in other industries who have a desire to join the AI revolution globally.


Position overview

Reporting to the Managing Director, the BDM will meet or exceed sales targets and provide regular reports detailing weekly activity and outcomes. The Business Development Manager (BDM) will be responsible for identifying, pursuing and closing opportunities within a wide range of industries.

The BDM will establish a quarterly plan to create and grow strong sales channels for our automation and Artificial Intelligence software and services. The role offers a rare and unique opportunity to enter the exponentially growing AI industry and become a key player in the Australian market.

Key accountabilities

  • Actively develop a strong understanding of the businesses products and services
  • Develop strategies for growing consulting and software sales revenues
  • Establish sales channels for each identified target industry sector
  • Contribute to Systemize Consulting’s product offering by reporting on successes and areas requiring further improvement
  • Drive sales leads throughout the whole sales lifecycle, including supporting the pre-sales teams, contract negotiation and execution
  • Prepare regular sales reports showing performance by channel, customer and results
  • Work with senior management to establish revenue targets across each product and service line
  • Build long-term relationships with new and existing customers

Qualifications and requirements

  • Extensive experience development business for either SaaS, software or consulting companies
  • Proven sales track record
  • Strong ability to learn new technologies
  • High level of communication skills
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills with skills to formally evaluate them
  • Experience in software development sales highly desirable
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications mandatory
  • Self-motivated and autonomous worker who is able to set and exceed agreed target
  • Melbourne-based residency mandatory requirement


On offer for the suitable candidate


  • Relevant technology training will be provided
  • Generous IT and communications provided
  • The freedom to develop the businesses sales strategy and plan
  • Genuine ongoing monthly sales commissions


Please apply using our direct website application process.\xa0\xa0

813686790:
[

Senior Manager Internal Audit

Company Name Medibank Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 450 views

Job description

At Medibank we stand for better health for better lives.


We are Medibank – an integrated healthcare company providing private health insurance and health solutions to 3.7 million Australians.


About Medibank

We're passionate about nurturing careers.


We support new innovation and thinking, and openly collaborate and share new ideas. We're healthy and active in our lives and wellbeing is encouraged at every level. Our people play an important role in the future of health and healthcare and we believe that working together, we're stronger.


The Opportunity

The Senior Manager Internal Audit will work closely with the GM Internal Audit and divisional leadership teams to support the design and delivery of the internal audit plan for their allocated divisional portfolios, monitor the timely completion of agreed audit actions and report results to relevant committee.


As a Senior Manager Internal Audit you will be accountable for audit planning and program management, internal audit project delivery, and providing professional advice stakeholders and client groups.


Key responsibilities include:

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Understanding changes occurring in the business and adapting the audit plan accordingly;

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Coordinating with other risk and assurance functions to share insights and ensure efficient control of testing;

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Managing and executing internal audit projects including developing scope of review, performing audit procedures, and identifying opportunities; and

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Being a trusted advisor to senior management, including acting as a key reference for new business initiatives and projects, in order to effectively convey high-quality business insight, advice and constructive challenge.

\xa0

About You\xa0

In order to be successful in this role, you will need to demonstrate extensive internal audit experience from within leading professional services firms or large listed companies. Health, insurance, or financial services experience will be highly-regarded.

\xa0

Your applied knowledge of principles and practices of internal auditing, including risk-based internal auditing methodologies and the IIA International Professional Practices Framework (IPPF) will match your experience in the development, prioritisation and optimisation of Assurance Plans (including interactions with key stakeholders and contributors).

\xa0

You have strong analytical skills to interpret and present complex technical information, including leveraging data analytic techniques where relevant, and excellent communication and stakeholder management skills to engage effectively and relay information appropriately to the audience.

\xa0

Relevant qualifications for this role include professional certifications such as GradCertIA, CIA, CA, CISA or CPA or a degree in accounting, finance, business administration, or similar

\xa0

What We Offer

In return for your hard work we offer a range of great benefits. Furthermore, we take the health and wellbeing of our employees seriously, offering flexible working conditions and encouraging wellbeing at all levels of life.


Medibank is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.


A Career at Medibank adds up to more. More achievement. More progress. More passion and more innovation for health.


For a career option that will suit you better, click to apply.

\xa0

For a confidential discussion, please email\xa0 Jeremy.Crawford@medibank.com.au.
